ITC Limited Reports Earnings Results for the Second Quarter and Six Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
ITC Limited reported earnings results for the second quarter and six months ended September 30, 2025. For the second quarter, the company reported revenue was INR 218,402.6 million compared to INR 221,472.5 million a year ago. Net income was INR 51,261.1 million compared to INR 49,928.7 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 4.09 compared to INR 3.93 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 4.09 compared to INR 3.93 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was INR 4.09 compared to INR 3.99 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was INR 4.09 compared to INR 3.99 a year ago.
For the six months, revenue was INR 456,518.2 million compared to INR 421,800.3 million a year ago. Net income was INR 103,703.1 million compared to INR 100,844.6 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 8.28 compared to INR 7.94 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 8.27 compared to INR 7.93 a year ago. Basic earnings per share was INR 8.28 compared to INR 8.07 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share was INR 8.27 compared to INR 8.06 a year ago.

data.title: Former MI6 Chief Sawers on Global Security
data.description:
John Sawers, former Chief at the UK Secret Intelligence Service, discusses the outlook for the global security landscape. He speaks with Haslinda Amin from the sidelines of the Barclays Asia Forum in Singapore.

Vodafone: acquires Skaylink to strengthen cloud and digital capabilities
data.description:
On Thursday Vodafone announced that it has signed a binding agreement to acquire Skaylink, a German company specializing in cloud services, digital transformation, and cybersecurity, for approximately €175m.

In a press release, the British mobile phone operator explained that the transaction is part of its strategy to accelerate growth in areas such as information system security, managed services, and cloud computing.

Skaylink, which is based in Munich and has offices throughout Germany and the rest of Europe, with a workforce of over 500 experts working on cloud migration projects using Microsoft and Amazon Web Services systems, as well as on the deployment of AI services for businesses.

Vodafone believes that these capabilities and its presence in certain markets will enable it to strengthen its digital services offering for businesses and public administrations.

The acquisition is expected to be finalized by the end of March 2026.

Vodafone plans to publish its Q1 2025/2026 results on November 11.
